content.label:
I‚Äôve probably put in 100 hours playing this game on iPad üôÇüôÇüôÇ
The new layout makes it unplayable üôÅüôÅüôÅ 
Very disappointed this is a great board game ‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è‚òπÔ∏è 
I hoped it would be fixed but so long later, no üòìüòìüòì

So sad

Since the change in layout this game is unplayable on my iPhone. I am not exaggerating. Most of the features simply cannot be accessed on the touch pad, or of you happen to use one, it usually is the wrong one.

Not sure why they changed the layout though I suspect it was designed to look better on tablets.

Loved this game, have moved on to other games. Not worth the frustration. It‚Äôs 2019 folks, do better.

Never heard of this game nor played it before the update. The reviews scared me off but gave it shot with the app sale. No regrets. Playing on mini iPad 4 and it is very much playable. Just went through the tutorial and no issues with reading cards.  Granted can't compare to what people are complaining about before but so far so good. Recommend it!

Update: 
So after playing a couple games I can see where people say you can't read all the cards. I'm guessing they mean the building cards if there's a lot at once. No problem as you can swipe and scroll them. Then double click to view it entirely. Not a big deal and nothing to prevent playing but it is a nuisance. Granted the playing field is limited and its mobile so what they have is probably as good as it gets.

Update: I stopped paying with AI Arilyn Moonblade. She ALWAYS wins matter how many AIs are in the game, she wins and by 20-30 points each time. Even with all the AIs difficulty set to easy. The game‚Äôs fun w/o her.

‚Äî‚Äî
...for mentioning in your review what device you‚Äôre playing D&D Lords Of Waterdeep on. I, too, have the 12.9‚Äù Pro so I knew I could buy the game and be able to read the smallest fonts with the ‚Äòcard zoom‚Äô feature. And to be honest, the redesigned (unknown to me at the time) UI is exactly what caught my eye first, before I knew it was a D&D game. By the way, there is a game status screen. Touch any player‚Äôs avatars. Plus a game history screen too. I‚Äôm already lovin‚Äô D&D Lords Of Waterdeep!
I like the landscape mode but it does not support the 2018 iPad res, thus runs in a smaller window with black bars on all sides.
In reading the reviews here it looks like an update ruined the game for phones.  But on iPad it is beautiful and plays just like the real game.
Was a great game...but now I‚Äôm playing less because I never know when it is my turn.

title.label: Excellent worker placement with D&D flavor text.

content.label:
So I actually started playing Waterdeep on the tabletop edition. Wasn‚Äôt really a big fan, but would play it now and then. My friend got the game on iOS, and I subsequently bought it and both expansions. That was several years ago, probably played the game a few times. 
Fast forward to last month when I reinstalled and started playing against a couple buddies. Found some random people online with similar skills and I am currently really enjoying this game. 

My only hiccup is the notification bug. I used to get notifications from the game, and it worked great. Somehow I am now not getting any. I checked my settings in the game and on my phone, but without any luck. 

Devs: please fix the notification bugs. Cheers!
I love this game a lot. I bought both expansions in a heart beat. The only thing is, it‚Äôs not optimized for iPhone Xs and the plying area is really small. Please update.

title.label: Seagull'd all over the game with a bad update, then ran for the hills

content.label:
This was a fantastic game. Lots of fun. But not only did then stop improving/adding content, their last update crapped all over the app and they have not touched it since. 

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME until they get a clue and update it. It's an embarrassment to the Waterdeep name at the current time.

title.label: Used to be great; now unplayable

content.label: Used to be the best board game on the App Store. But the new update ruined the ability to play due to the scale and orientation of the board. Devs should roll this one back but the company already has our money so they aren‚Äôt losing anything from us and they are gaining money from the new users due to cross-platform ability.

title.label: gimmicky update detracts from core gameplay

content.label:
Previously great adaptaion of the boardgame was marred by a misguided UI redesign when updating the game for modern versions of iOS.

The core mechanics are fun. The previous UI let the game shine. Now it gets in the way, even on my iPad Pro.

There's also a bug during scoring. If you played as Halaster the scoring screen treats you as Danilo. I was scored 8 points when I had completed 11 quests and 7 buildings as Halaster.
Please add portrait mode back in and iPhone X aspect ratio support!!!
It just repeats the first round over and over.  With different lords.   Such a shame.

title.label: New user interface ruins game on phone

content.label: This went from a wonderful port to an unplayable one.  The text is unreadable due to small size on cards and the board while playing on a phone.

I played this game for many years and absolutely loved it. Recently, I downloaded it again and was saddened to see the perspective and interface changed in such a way that the game is now unplayable.

What happened to the old version and whose hair-brained idea was it to completely rebuild this app? 

Remember that old saying? If it ain‚Äôt broke, don‚Äôt fix it. Playdek sure screwed the pooch with this one, I won‚Äôt be buying anymore Playdek titles until they restore the original LoW app.

This game was SO GOOD! I‚Äôm truly saddened by this.

title.label: Excellent port of a solid game

content.label: I don‚Äôt know if this will be an easy game to pick up unless you‚Äôve played it over the board.  But if you have, it works great!  We love to play pass n play and solo against the AI.

title.label: Great game when it‚Äôs not crashing

content.label: Love this game both in physical and digital formats. Except that every time I tap ‚Äúadd to friends list‚Äù for someone I‚Äôm playing with, the game crashes. No way to add an actual IRL friend because her user name comes up as someone else with no other option. Fix the crashing please.

Great game based off of board game and updated for 64bit. 

However, they did an overhaul of the map, making it 3-d and changing from day to night. Sounds cool, looks cool, doesn‚Äôt work well as it is now. First, top down is still best view to play so while it‚Äôs fun to make the buildings pop up in 3-D, there is no real reason to play that way. Maybe Playdeck can use it in animations? Secondly, the cards are displayed to small both in and out of zoom. Absolutely no reason to have the card display zoom to be that small. Literally, can‚Äôt read all the text. I‚Äôm hoping they find a way to solve these issues and I think Playdek needs more UX strategy.

The game is amazing. The player base is small because all the iPhone users no longer play due to not being able to read the text after landscape mode became the only style. But if you use an iPad, the small text is perfectly fine.

title.label: Display not properly supported on IPhone X

content.label: This is a fantastic port of a fantastic board game. However I just upgraded my phone and the display is really small on this screen with no options to change it. If the devs fix this I will change the review score to 5 stars.
The game is great but much harder to play since the update awhile back. I have pretty much stopped playing since the change.

Can‚Äôt play anymore. Heat on earth were the developers thinking???

Please please go back to a portrait orientation or allow a choice.

Cross platform play is why I bought this version. I already have it on the PC with the DLC.... so play on my same account via iPhone I have to buy the game (again) and the DLC(again)?

A rather disappointing method to rake in extra cash. Be a long time before I buy an app for cross platform play. 

Solid game on PC, but very disappointing implementation on the iPhone for those who have already bought everything.

Update:  Still a great game 4 years after I bought it.  I will admit that the cards and board are hard to read since it was updated to iOS 11.  Fortunately I have the 12.9 inch pro and zooming takes care of that.  I would not try to play this game on an iPhone however due to the detail. 

At first I thought the AI was tough.  But I kept playing and now I am winning on easy.  The AI is just right because it challenges you to be a better player.  This is my favorite game.

The cards are so small that I can hardly read the text. Which can be fixed as each card only occupies about 50% of the screen. It would make more sense to have the cards use more space so that the text is readable. 

I love this game, but this oversight is causing me to not play as often as I would like.

I paid four dollars for a piece of junk. It‚Äôs horrible and no one I mean no one plays it.
So I have to play offline.

I want a REFUND AND THAT IS IT!!!!!
I‚Äôm into the forgotten realms and city states like Waterdeep in particular. Fun VP style game I can play alone or with friends. My only complaint is much of the text is too small and hard to read.

I was hesitant to get this app because of the poor reviews but I‚Äôm glad I did. Having never played using the old UI, I think this is fine, no issues at all. The game plays great. All the people that gave is one star are being overly harsh.  This is also a great board game.
Can‚Äôt read cards.

title.label: I should have listened to the reviews

content.label: Wish I hadn‚Äôt purchased but it was on sale. Looks like I burned my money.  Playing on an iPad Air2. Text is tiny. Very hard to work out what it going on. Judging by the other reviews I think the simpler interface that was used earlier was the way to go. It is too unplayable at the moment.

title.label: Update did make the game less playable

content.label: Love the game but the update hurt it.

title.label: update ruined the game, I want my money back

content.label: This game used to run quite well. Now they added a bunch of pointless animations which you can‚Äôt turn off, and even in single player you have to confirm every action like fifteen times. This makes the game unplayable on earlier devices. What a terrible update, and frankly I feel robbed since I bought the base game and expansions and now it‚Äôs ruined, please let us turn the new animations off and turn off the need to confirm everything fifty times like we used to.

title.label: Broken Sometimes Now But Was Great

content.label: Bought both DLCs and was in the middle of three games when the app started saying that I didn‚Äôt have the expansions. The ‚ÄúRestore Purchases‚Äù button does absolutely nothing and no update is available to fix the issue. Social profiles for PlayDek are dark. UPDATE: After force quitting the app multiple times, the game suddenly shows my expansion purchases and I‚Äôm back in action. It‚Äôs a testament to the quality of the game that I‚Äôm excited that it‚Äôs working again. I‚Äôd would give it five stars if it were more stable with regular updates but at this point, I can‚Äôt recommend it.

title.label: Tech support issues but overall great game play

content.label: I love this app and have been playing LOWD for years as the board game and the app. Something happened yesterday where the in app purchases seemingly vanished and getting in contact with tech support has been impossible. Please help! I‚Äôm in the 8th round of a game and it‚Äôs my turn and yet somehow suddenly the app says I can‚Äôt play that game because I haven‚Äôt purchased the extensions.
to simplify it the ild version is much better than this one

title.label: I agree with update hurting the game

content.label: Sad for updates making the view harder and therefore not as easy to play. WHY???

title.label: App support doesn‚Äôt work and app isn‚Äôt working right

content.label: I‚Äôm in the middle of a game and it tells me I don‚Äôt have the expansion to play this game (undermountain). I sure do. I paid extra for it and have been using it for many months. I click restore purchases, nothing happens. I go to the App Store to email the wankers who created the game (and messed it up with the dumb board update) and it tells me the URL can‚Äôt be found, so I can‚Äôt even get in contact with them to explain my issue. I want my money back Apple. I‚Äôm about to call support and get a refund.

this game is fantastic. I‚Äôm dropping a 5-star review to a 3 simply because there is no more offline support for the dlc content. I play offline quite a bit with my boo but we used to be able to play with the add-ons that I *bought* and now cannot. don‚Äôt take things away from your customers with updates, do the opposite. bummed out until I can access the dlc offline.

title.label: Amazing Tabletop Game, Absolute Trash App

content.label:
First let me thank the developers for having the game forfeit for me if I don‚Äôt take my turn within 5 min.  Apparently the developers don‚Äôt want you to go to the bathroom, drive home, or make coffee, without being tied to the game. 

It‚Äôs also overwhelmingly obnoxious to hit the green progress arrow every single time something happens.  

It‚Äôs also fun if you watch and entire end round sequence.   Switch out of the app.  Switch back. And have to watch the entire animation sequence again. 

Normally a one star review should be reserved for something that simply doesn‚Äôt function.  This is just close enough.  Absolute waste of time to consider this app.

Originally was a wonderful adaption of one of my favorite board games. However the new landscape-only layout is harder to view and the controls are not as straight forward as they were in earlier releases. Even on my iPad Pro, the view doesn‚Äôt work well. Also, I don‚Äôt feel there is a need to constantly require me to confirm every action.
This used to be my favorite app on iPad. The update made it so you can‚Äôt play in portrait mode which makes it unplayable.

I don't know how someone could play this on anything but the very largest iPad. This is ridiculous, especially for one of the most expensive games on the store. Don't throw away your money on this, they didn't even try to make it playable on a phone.

title.label: Still too great not to play

content.label: App runs slowly on my 3rd generation iPad, but it's still my favorite board game adaptation because it does a good job of being infinitely variable and allowing me to play almost as often as I wish with asynchronous gameplay.

I was excited that they sped up the AI, but the update from the original still lacks the flow of the old game.  I had logged over a 1000 games before. I hope whoever play tested the new version at Playdek got the boot.

title.label: Played this game every day, until the new interface

content.label: I played this game 1-2 times a day for well over a year. It all came to a grinding halt with the new interface. It‚Äôs terrible compared to the old. Multiple clicks to confirm an action and obscured bits of the screen made me stop playing. Haven‚Äôt touched it in months. Please revert to the old UI or give us an option to change it and I‚Äôll be back ASAP. And would it have been so hard to save / port over the games played and win/loss info? I had 250+ games played and was, for months, trying to even out my win/loss record. All gone now. 5 stars when the old UI comes back

title.label: Difficult to Play After the Update

content.label: The game itself is great. The app used to be great as well, but is almost unplayable with the new horizontal layout. Cards and components now appear smaller. Available quests are impossible to read without tapping to enlarge, and cards played by opponents are difficult to read without slowing down the animation, which slows the game down as well. Please restore the old vertical layout, or at least make it available as an option. This was a 5-star app before this update.

title.label: They ruined it with the new layout/update

content.label: I used to played this game daily, since the new ‚Äòimproved‚Äô layout it‚Äôs completely unplayable.  I wish I had the option to get my money back before they ruined it. 8-(
Great way to ruin your company's reputation and lose a huge fan base,

title.label: Went from favorite to not played

content.label:
It used to be laid out perfectly, all elements easy to see, quick steps, nothing getting in the way and expand/collapse points perfectly placed.
   I was playing once per day at least and enjoying every game.

New layout is awful, sizing is off, added steps slows gameplay and introduces tedium.  Pacing is off now, components hard to see and flow is no longer intuitive.

I guess I should thank the designers.  I have all those hours back now....
